Name: Lock 'n Load: Not One Step Back
Description:
Lock ‘n Load: Not One Step Back is Lock ‘n Load’s first foray into the Eastern Front of World War II. This expansion includes the units, rules, and scenarios that gamers need to recreate the desperate struggles on the Russian steppe, ruins of Stalingrad, and partisan-infested woodlands.

Command Soviet heavy tanks, such as the KV-1, SU-152, and JS-2. Brew up hapless T34 tanks with your incredible King Tiger. Use the Soviet Guards to lead counterattacks in the city, and the new German Pioneers to retake lost ground. Ambush German convoys with Partisans and whip cowards back into line with Commissars.

The game’s armor includes T-34/76, T-70 T-34/85, JS-2, KV-1, SU-76, SU-85, SU-152, King Tigers,A Soviet 76mm ATG prepares to take on a German King Tiger German Halftracks, and Sd 222 armored cars. Infantry additions consist of Guards (two flavors), Line Soviets (again, two types), Partisans, Commissars, Nurses, veteran German infantry, German Pioneers, Molotov Cocktails, DP-28, 45mm and 76mm Anti-tank guns, 82mm mortars, and 12.7mm machine guns.

The hex halos have been seriously tuned down. 255 die cut counters and three, mounted geomorphic mapboards.

Not One Step Back is not a complete game. This is an expansion and requires both Band of Heroes and Swift & Bold to play all twelve of its scenarios. Most, however, of the missions can be played with just Not One Step Back and Band of Heroes.

Expands:

    Lock 'n Load: Band of Heroes
    Lock 'n Load: Swift and Bold

Name: Monster Liner
Description:
A luxury liner hits an iceberg and begins to sink. Unfortunately, some of the world's great monsters that had been captured and placed in this boat as part of the liner's entertainment - a giant ape, a vampire, a fish-man, a wolf-man, a mummy and a man-monster - roam free now that their cages have been broken. It's up to the stalwart heroes who captured these creatures the first time, to take them down permanently. And they have to do it amongst, fleeing passengers, unsuspecting maidens and frantic crew. Oh, and before this ship sinks.

This game was the winner of a "Monster-Themed Design Contest" that Z-Man Games held on the Board Game Designer's Forum.

Name: Naseby: The End of a Reign
Description:
Twin of Edgehill, this one is a game on the last battle of the English Civil War fought by King Charles I before his capture and beheading. It shares with its twin brother the same gaming system and the same astonishing graphics for the map and counters art and it makes for another fast and challenging head to head game, with two armies of almost the same capabilities and strengths, that is very fun to play also solitaire in less than an hour.

Contains:
11 x 17" full color map (2 - 8.5 x 11" parts)
120 full color counters

Print-n-Play version available at:
http://www.wargamedownloads.com/item.php?item=551

Name: Chronology: Sports Edition
Description:
Chronology - Sports Edition: A Card Game for All Time

Players build a time line of cards. Each card contains a sports event and the year in which it occurred. Players begin with one card each, which is placed face up in front of them. On her turn, a player is read an event from a new card; the player must then indicate the position on her own time line where the card should be placed. If she's correct she places the card in her own time line; if not, the next player gets an opportunity to win the card. The first player with ten cards wins.

The cards from this edition may be mixed with the original Chronology game to create even more combinations.

Name: One Bad Apple
Description:
In this children's dexterity game, you must pick an apple from the barrel on your turn.  You can either try for the big red one that's worth the most points, or try a smaller one that may be easier to pick.

Reach for the stem and lift the apple up, but be careful!  If you pick it without disturbing any other apples, you get to keep it and score points.  But if the apple you pick makes the wormy apple pop up it goes back into the barrel and you lose points on that turn.  Then reset the game for continued play.

Name: Fun at the Zoo Game
Description:
Fun at the Zoo is a children's game.  From the side of the box:

Players choose the colored marker they wish to play and place it at the ZOO entrance.  To determine playing turns, players spin the spinner one time and the player with the highest number begins first, and the other players follow in turn to the left.  Shuffle the Suspense Cards and place face down in the center of the playing board.

Players spin the spinner and move forward the amount of spaces indicated on the spinner dial.  At "Your Zoo" you may "Feed" some of your Zoo friends and some you may not.  Upon landing on a space marked for one of your Zoo Friends, player draws one of the Suspense Cards.  If the players marker is on a space marked "You May Feed" and the Suspense Card states to "Feed", player may go ahead 2 spaces.  If the turned over card says "Do Not Feed" player must go back 2 spaces.  By the same token, if the player marker is on a "Do Not Feed" space and the card turned over says "Do Not Feed" player may go ahead 2 spaces, but if the card says to "Feed" player must go back 2 spaces.  Replace the suspense card face down under the pile after use.  The first player to arrive back to the entrance wins the game!

Name: Employee of the Week
Description:
"Play as a sleazy computer salesman in this insanely, chaotic card/ dexterity game of sensory overload."

In Employee of the Week, there are seven working days during which the players must collect the necessary parts to fulfill as many orders as possible.

Employee of the Week is self-published by Toronto-based Steve Lefort (creator of Treasure Quest), and can be played at various Toronto Area Boardgaming Society (www.tabsonline.net) gatherings.

Employee of the Week is currently slated for a 4th Quarter 2007 release.

Name: Xombies Attack!!!
Description:
Following on the heels of his extremely popular Treasure Quest, Steve Lefort brings you Xombies Attack!!!

Xombies Attack!!! is a whole new zombie experience, finally bringing you the look and feel of a classic Romero film that fits on your dining room table!

Terrain Note The terrain shown in these photos is from WorldWorksGames "Urban Mayhem"
product line. (Please note that ANY terrain will suffice for this game and this is NOT an endorsement of the WorldWorksGames Products)

In this grid based miniatures game, Xombies have overrun the city, lusting for flesh.  Four very different squads must work their way through the city, fighting off hordes of Xombies while trying to reach their individual objectives. Search buildings, rescue panicked civilians, find weapons and items while avoiding nuclear obliteration. Quick paced tactics will award you victory! Recklessness will infect you with the bloodlust of the undead...

"Xombies Attack!!!" is currently under development and is slated for a 4th Quarter 2007 release.

Name: Renaissance Raiders
Description: Card driven, hex based miniatures rules for Border Reivers and the Wars of Religion.  The rules area event cards and combat is resolved either by traditional six sided dice or by using the sticker templates provided to create a set of special dice.

Name: Texas Renaissance Festival Game
Description: The object of the game is to be the first to enter the Royal Castle by winning a series of contests and challenges.

Name: Dynamiki
Description:
Two states have declared war against each other.  You are appointed the Supreme Commander of one of the states.  Your forces: two armored, two mechanized, two airborne and five infantry divisions.  How will you save your country?

Age-old strategy and the principles and weapons of modern warfare are brought together in the exciting game of Dynamiki.  Based on the ancient Chinese game of Hsiangchi, Dynamiki reflects the concepts of some of history's most brilliant strategists.  Match your wits against your opponent's but be prepared: tricks, twists and surprises await you at every turn.

Dynamiki is a modernized version of the age-old Chinese game of Hsiangchi whose original form is believed to be the world's earliest precursor of chess.  Historical documents showed that it existed in China as early as 2400 years ago.

The pieces are: the Headquarters (building), the Capital Garrison (guard shack), Periphral Garrison (pillbox), Armored Force (tank), Motorized Infantry (gun jeep), the Airborne (helicopter), and the Infantry (soldier on foot).

Dynamiki also contains two other fast-paced, amusing Chinese games: Anki and Dakitzi, offering you a wide variety of game playing pleasure.

Anki - Combines skill and chance in an exciting and unpredictable contest of elimination.

Dakitzi - Somewhat like poker, but is more flexible and tricky, and moves much more faster.

Name: Activity Ruhrpott
Description:
This follow-on to Activity (1993) premiered at Essen 2000.

It is a party game for teams with progress being tracked using up to 4 pawns on the board.

One player of a team draws a card showing something from the Ruhr area of Germany.  Then, depending on the card type, the player either draws on paper, silently acts out or verbally describes what is displayed on the card so that his teammates can guess it.

A sand timer determines whether the clue was achieved in sufficient time and whether the team's pawn may advance.

Usually lasts about an hour.

Name: Peter R. de Vries: Misdaadverslaggever
Description:
In this game the players are trying to solve a crime by combining different clues. The trick is which clues to use and which to discard. If you play your cards right you will be able to close the case by connecting all the five facets of the crime: Suspect, Motive, Witness, Crime scene and Traces.

The game is named after the "famous" Dutch crime reporter Peter R. de Vries.

Name: Pompeu Fabra i el seu temps
Description:
Pompeu Fabra i el seu temps was edited to commemorate the 75th anniversary of the publication of the Diccionari general de la llengua catalana ("Catalan Language General Dictionary") in 1932 by the linguist and Catalan language reformer Pompeu Fabra, who modernized Catalan grammar and orthography. His dictionary is widely considered a milestone in the history of Catalan language, as for the first time modern linguistic ideas were introduced in the grammar.

In the game the players together rebuild Pompeu Fabra's life and works, as well as the various social, cultural and political events that took place during his life: from his birth in Barcelona in 1868 until his death in exile at Prada de Conflent (France) in 1948. Each year in the life of Pompeu Fabra is represented by a card, and the players try to fill in the holes in the chronology, which in the initial setup is formed only by four years. The filling rules are simple and the players receive points each time a grouping of three, six or nine cards is completed.

Name: 24 Trading Card Game
Description:
Taken from the Press Pass Inc. press release:

Press Pass, Inc. [recently] announced a licensing agreement with the Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation for the 24™ TCG (Trading Card Game). Based on the action-packed drama airing every Monday night at 9:00 p.m. (8:00 p.m. Central) on Fox, the 24™ TCG is scheduled to launch in August 2007 and builds on the success established by Press Pass with its critically acclaimed Fullmetal Alchemist TCG.

Currently in its sixth season, 24™ follows the life of CTU agent Jack Bauer (played by Kiefer Sutherland) and his allies, minute by minute, through a single 24-hour day full of heart-stopping action and intense drama as they work to quell a threat to the American people. The Emmy award-winning series boasts nearly 16 million viewers each week and has inspired a wide range of licensed properties, including PlayStation2 video games, novels, comic books, and an upcoming line of action figures.

“This is a license we’re thrilled to get,” said Edward Bolme, TCG Product Manager for Press Pass. “We’re designing this game to capture the essence of action and tension that the show portrays. We think the fans will find it a very exciting and attractive game.”

“Fans of 24™ will love this game,” added Virginia King, Executive Director of Fox Licensing and Merchandising. “Serious collectors who don’t play games will want to collect these cards.”

Created by the award-winning Press Pass, Inc. design team responsible for the Fullmetal Alchemist TCG (voted #1 New TCG of 2005 by readers of Scrye and InQuest and Best Anime TCG of 2006 by Anime Insider), the 24™ TCG will let you play either with or against CTU in a fast-paced struggle for victory. The game will feature 24-card decks and can be played in 15 to 20 minutes. Press Pass will also conduct a comprehensive marketing and promotion campaign as well as an aggressive tournament system.

Name: 'Round the World Joe
Description: This game consists of words and phrases that are used to fill in the blanks of Joe's traveling narrative. This game measures 5 3/4" x 4 1/4" x 1".

Name: Chippendale's After Hours Game
Description: Adult game where players land on spaces and then have to do certain things in order to make money. Take it off, tell a dirty joke, play charades, make a toast, go to the dance floor etc.

Name: Occult Wars
Description:
Ever fancied gaming "Buffy: The Vampire Slayer", "Underworld" or even "Constantine"?

Occult Wars is a set of miniature wargaming rules that allow you to game in a horror setting, playing as a group of humans hunting horrific monsters.

But that's not all.

You can also play as a group of Vampires, Werewolves, or even Angelic or Demonic Beings. Each faction has it's own abilities and unique weaknesses

The game rules and for 'skirmish' style games, using up to 10 or so miniatures a side. And includes campaign rules for character enhancement between encounters.

Additionally, Occult Wars contains many additions that allow you to play the game as an RPG-Lite style campaign.

Name: Gemüsereis
Description:
"Gemüsereis" (vegetable rice) was included as "Spiel im Heft" (game in the zine) in Spielbox 6/87, where 3 games were published, that could be played with special miniature fruit figures.

This game needs 5 of these figures: 1 tomato, 1 onion, 1 paprika, 1 mushroom and 1 corncob. The first 4 are the normal fruit figures, while the corncob is used to determine the movements.

The board has 4 fruit spaces, 6 cooking pot spaces and 10 movement spaces. Each of the 6 cooking pot spaces shows 4 fields, 2 empty ones and 2 showing one of the 4 normal fruit figures.

Winner of the game is the player who can fill one of the 6 cooking spot with the missing 2 fruits.

Name: Medellin
Description:
This game is a wargame published by the French magazine Casus Belli (Issue 13 - Feb 1983).
The game covers the Medellin battle (28 march 1809) opposing French and Spanish troops.

Name: Mickey Mantle's Big League Baseball
Description: Mickey Mantle's Big League Baseball is one of 6 games that were included in a grouping of games from the Gardner Company. All games came in the same box under the title of Big 6 Sports Games.  This is a simple spin and find the results game. Also included in the box with this game was;  Gardner's Championship Golf, All Star Basketball, Gardner's Stock Car Race  , All Star Football and Verne Gagne Wrestling. Mickey Mantles Big League Baseball is a simple and easy game to play. On each play the team in the field flips a colored die and the team at bat spins a spinner. The color on the die and the number on the spinner determine the results of the play.

Name: Verne Gagne Wrestling
Description: Verne Gagne Wrestling is one of 6 games that were included in a grouping of games from the Gardner Company. All games came in the same box under the title of Big 6 Sports Games.  This is a simple spin and find the results game. Also included in the box with this game was; Mickey Mantle's Big League Baseball,  All Star Football, Gardner's Championship Golf, All Star Basketball and Gardner's Stock Car Race  .

Name: All Star Football
Description: All Star Football is one of 6 games that were included in a grouping of games from the Gardner Company. All games came in the same box under the title of Big 6 Sports Games.  This is a simple spin and find the results game. Also included in the box with this game was; Mickey Mantle's Big League Baseball,  All Star Basketball,  Gardner's Stock Car Race  ,  Gardner's Championship Golf, and     Verne Gagne Wrestling.

Name: All Star Basketball
Description:
All Star Basketball is one of 6 games that were included in a grouping of games from the Gardner Company. All games came in the same box under the title of Big 6 Sports Games.  This is a simple spin and find the results game. Also included in the box with this game was; Mickey Mantle's Big League Baseball , Gardner's Stock Car Race   , Gardner's Championship Golf, Verne Gagne Wrestling, and All Star Football

The object of the game is to score the highest number of baskets and free throws. To setup, you shuffle the Referee's cards and place in a pile, face down. Players determine which side of the board will be HOME and which is VISTORS. Play begins with a jump ball in the center circle. Players spin until both arrows point to the same team (innermost circle) to determine the Offensive player. The ball will move in the direction of their target basket. Offense player spins again and places the ball in the color position on the Court matching the color indicated by the arrow. Players both spin reading the numbers on the outer edge of the spinners. Ball movement will occur based on the numbers spun by both Offense and Defense. The possible outcomes are: the ball moves in the direction of the error on the board, ball is intercepted, ball is stolen, or a basket is made. If Defense ever spins a 4, the Offense picks up a Referee card and follows it instructions. Player is allowed 3 spins for a free throw shot.

Players determine length of time by agreement on time limit or number of points.

Name: Gardner's Stock Car Race
Description:
Gardner's Stock Car Race  is one of 6 games that were included in a grouping of games from the Gardner Company. All games came in the same box under the title of Big 6 Sports Games.  This is a simple spin and find the results game. Also included in the box with this game was; All Star Football, Mickey Mantle's Big League Baseball, Verne Gagne Wrestling, Gardner's Championship Golf, and All Star Basketball.

Players spin to determine lane order. The player in lane #1 spins and moves that many spaces forward on the track, followed by the car in lane #2, and so on. To change lanes, the car moves sideways (not diagonally) on the track. If a player spins or lands on a "Draw Card" space, they draw a card from the "PIT" deck and follows the directions. To overtake another car, players must drive around the car ahead unless their spin lands them directly on the same space. In this case, the overtaken car moves back one space and the passing car takes their position. Use the score pad to track the number of laps. After 6 laps, the game ends and the winner is the first car to pass the finish line.

Name: Gardner's Championship Golf
Description:
Gardner's Championship Golf was one of 6 games that were included in a package of games called Big 6 Sport Games. This is a simple spin and find the results game. Also included in the box were Verne Gagne Wrestling, All Star Football, Mickey Mantle's Big League Baseball, All Star Basketball,   Gardner's Stock Car Race  .

Players take turns teeing off by spinning the spinner and rolling the color die. The inner circle on the spinner indicates the zone the board and the color die indicates the colored space in that zone where the ball lands. After all players have teed off, the player furthest from the hole plays first. Players reference the Shot Chart corresponding to their zone/color to determine where their ball lands next. A combination of Zone VI, Red, means the ball landed in the hole. If you receive this combination on the tee off, you earned a "hole-in-one".

When all players have landed on the green, the Putting Green, Zone VI chart is used to determine the number of putts to hole out. Individual scores are tracked on the score pad (each move counts as one "stroke"). Play 9 or 18 holes of golf. The player with the fewest total strokes across all holes is the winner.

Name: Steve Garvey's Superstar Baseball
Description: Steve Garvey's Superstar Baseball is a baseball-themed dice game not a baseball simulation. The game is divided into five parts: hitting ground balls, bunting, hit and run play, base running, and power hitting. In every case, a player takes a turn by rolling the four dice and checking the appropriate table for the results. A player could score one or two points each turn. The player who has more points at the end of the game wins. The game comes with magnetic ball and magnetic players, dice, and instructions.

Name: Pirelli
Description:
Pirelli is a card game played with a standard deck of 52 cards.  Points are scored by having the largest total value in rows, columns, and diagonals on a 5x5 board.  Additional bonus points are given by having adjacent cards of the same suit.  Play is simultaneous with each player selecting a card from his or her cards.  The player with the lower numbered card then places both cards.

This game was the basis for the game FNAP.

Name: Kochtopf-Spiel
Description:
The "Kochtopf-Spiel" (=cooking pot game) was included as "Spiel im Heft" (game in the zine) in Spielbox 6/87, where 3 games were published, that could be played with special miniature fruit figures.

This game needs 5 of these fruit figures: 1 tomato, 1 paprika, 1 onion, 1 mushroom and as special figure 1 corncob.

The board shows 5x5 spaces, where five 3x3 areas are specially marked. Each area is reserved for one playing figure, that is each figure can only move within its area.
The four 3x3 areas in the corners are reserved for the 4 normal playing figures, the area in the middle is the corncob's one.

Each player has a set of 8 cards: 4 showing a fruit figure and 4 are numbered from 1-4. These cards are used to move the playing pieces, but a move is always put together from 2 cards from 2 different players!

Object of the game is to move 3 of the 4 normal figures in the centre area and get the corncob to one of the corners of his area. The player who sits nearest to that corner is the winner of the game.

Name: Flusi
Description: Flusi is a simple action game based on a "sock monster" character popularized in childrens' books. The game box doubles as a sock drawer for the game. Players load up sock monsters onto a simple catapult and fling them trying to hit the sock drawer. For each monster than makes it into the drawer, socks are taken. Whoever gets the most socks in a round gets a clothespin. Get two clothespins and win the game! Simple and fun, and kids often do better than the adults.

Name: SHA-EE: The Game of Destiny
Description: SHA-EE is a path-building game. Players start at the edge of the board and place triangular tiles to extend their paths towards the center space. There are restrictions on when each section of the board can be entered. Some spaces must be occupied by the players' small guard pieces; occupying some of these spaces requires rolling the special die, and occupation of others can be challenged, which also requires rolling the die. The game ends when someone occupies the center space with their king, but the winner of the game is the one who scores the most points from their occupied spaces, not necessarily the player who reaches the center.

Name: Tom & Jerry Game
Description: This is a spin and move game. Object of the game is to begin in the mouse hole of your color and then by spinning the correct colors leave your hole,  find your sweet - whether its cake pie sugar cookies - land on that treat and then get back into your hole in the floor first.

Name: 'Bouta Face
Description: Bouta Face is a matching-memory card game (It is About Faces). The specialized card deck has 11 different colorful funny and amusing faces. Most card games use one side of the card -  Bouta Face uniquely uses both sides on every turn.  There are 3 game variations - a beginners version, an advanced version and a solitaire game.  All three have the objective of matching as many identical faces in pairs as possible. The person who collects the most pairs wins.  The games are easy to learn, and hugely entertaining. Unlike any card game you have ever played. Recommended Ages 7 and up, 2 to 4 players.

Name: Terry Tell Time
Description:
Game for very young children that helps them tell time. Features a colorful playing board divided into 4 color sections, 24 Terry Tell Time Activity Cards (4 each of 6 different scenes), and 1 Clock N' Color Spinner.

Based on the TV show "The Adventures of Terry Tell Time", featuring Carol Reed and the Bunin Puppets. Captain Terry (seen on the game box) and his sister Tina Tell Time (both from Switzerland) were the puppets that helped children learn to tell time. The 1950's kids show also featured cartoons, music and more.

Name: The Merry Bell Game
Description: A friendly little game for 2, 3 or 4 young children. The object of   The Merry Bell Game is to be the first to move from Start to Finish, following the colorful dots on the gameboard. Players ring their bells when they spin their color and when they land on a picture space.

Name: Berlin: Red Vengeance
Description:
The Battle for the Reichstag, April 28th-May 1st 1945

Including a revised map with larger hexes, and all errata included, this version of Heat of Battle's Historical ASL module details 10 historical scenarios and full campaign rules for the Soviet assault on Berlin.

Also included is a small sheet of 56 counters, including Gestapo Leaders, dug in tanks (treated as pillboxes - including King Tigers!) and numerous others.

Oh, and Hitler.

The game requires the ASL rules, Beyond Valor, Yanks, Kampfgruppe Peiper II, and also references Red Barricades.

Expands:

    Advanced Squad Leader
    Beyond Valor: ASL Module 1
    Yanks: ASL Module 3
    Kampfgruppe Peiper II: ASL Historical Module 3
    Red Barricades: ASL Historical Module 1


(all are required for expansion play)

Name: Fire Chief
Description: The Fire Chief Board Game comes from  See Right Games and was produced in 1957.  A game where players try to protect the local neighborhood from fires by walking on the paths throughout the neighborhood using a spinner and then encountering problems using another spinner. Whoever does best at protecting the neighborhood wins the game.

Name: ATS: Parker's Crossroads
Description:
An expansion for the Advanced Tobruk: Tank Battles in North Africa 1940-43 System game on the Battle of the Bulge, Darkest December, depicting the fighting between US and German forces in the Baraque de Fraiture area in Belgium, December 1944.  Contains several new scenarios, a selection of new counters and a new map based on Pedro Ramis' on-the-ground research.

Ownership of DARKEST DECEMBER or German Personnel, US Personnel, US AFVs, German AFVs, and the LATE WAR GERMAN AND AMERICAN AFVS sheet (DD_1) is needed to use this expansion.

Expands:

    Advanced Tobruk: Tank Battles in North Africa 1940-43

Name: Word Factory
Description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION

    
    
         The information that BGG has on this item indicates that Word Factory is a non-authorized version of Big Boggle.

    


From the publisher:
A mind-boggling word game guaranteed to make a player eat words, think words, dream words in just a few games.

Players shake up 25 letter cubes and make words out of adjoining letters. As fast as he can, a player searches for words that he hopes his opponents won't find.

Name: Gruff Goats
Description:
From the website:

"    In Goats Gruff you are a fairy in charge of guiding your goats (big, medium, and little) to the Island of Good Grass. There are four bridges from the Outside Land to the Island. Two trolls move among these four bridges. Play cards to take and use the magic wands: if you have the proper magic wand you can move a certain-sized goat or a troll. Also, if you have just the right combinations of cards you can stir the dragon, who will swoop down to eat one of your rival's goats. Who will be the first to help three goats get to the Island?

This is a children's game because strategy can be neglected for straightforward play and the way in which players compete for the magic wands is childishly simple (I'm taking it... No you're not... Yes I am... No you're not...). Adults would probably enjoy this game as much as children only when tired or inebriated. For a more mature, intellectual, similar game based on the same game mechanic please see my Walls and Stairways. "

Available at http://davidvs.net/boardgames/
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Three Billy Goats Gruff

Name: An Artifact for Dr. Storn?
Description:
From the website:

"An Artifact for Dr. Storn? blends diplomacy and board-movement in an original way, creating an interstellar treasure hunt that appeals to both a childlike desire to collect nifty artifacts and a mature desire for strategy. Players are agents sent by different planetary governments to collect famous artifacts. Since some artifacts cannot be picked up unless you are carrying others, players constantly trade and steal artifacts. How should you balance trading for mutual benefit with hindering your opponents' progress? How can you time your interplanetary travel so you are carrying or steal the artifacts you need the moment you return to your home world? Should you abandon your main quest and search for the mysterious Book of Knowledge, that if correctly handled will allow a second player to claim victory?"

Name: Thought Eaters
Description:
From the website:

"Thought Eaters is a quick, cute maze game. Each player is attempting to navigate a path to the center of the board. If all goes well this path involves seven turns. Players draw and play two "turn right" or "turn left" tiles each turn to represent their animal's own planning. Each turn players also can move one tile anywhere on the board. If your plan is good enough your animal moves along its path of tiles. You will need strategy and diplomacy to reach the goal first."

Name: Commands & Colors: Ancients Expansion Pack #3 – The Roman Civil Wars
Description:
The Roman Civil Wars will feature familiar units with new capabilities. The Roman legions have evolved into the deadly fighting units of legend. In terms of Commands and Colors performance, the medium infantry units (representing less experienced legions) and heavy infantry units (representing the veteran legions) will now be able to move two hexes without engaging in close combat, or still move one hex and have close combat (as well as throwing their pilum - a capability acquired in Commands & Colors: Ancients Expansion Pack #2 â€“ Rome vs the Barbarians). You will be able to fight battles with medium and heavy infantry as you have never fought them before!

Rules-wise, if you've played Commands & Colors: Ancients, you'll have no trouble at all learning the few special rules for these legionary infantry units, for the basic mechanics remain unchanged. The battle dice resolve combat quickly and the Command cards provide an element of luck that creates a fog of war and presents players with both challenges and opportunities for victory. Yet the tactics you need to execute conform remarkably well to the advantages and limitations inherent to the various Ancient units, their weapons, terrain and the history.

But that's not all... GMT is also going to include another mounted mapboard in Expansion #3, configured to be mated to the mounted board from Commands & Colors: Ancients Expansion Pack #2 â€“ Rome vs the Barbarians. In addition the Commands & Colors: Epic Ancients new Command rules for fighting large-scale historical battles will provide those of you interested in fighting truly large-scale, multi-player, ancient battles the perfect and unique opportunity to do so with a number of your friends.

Expands:

    Commands & Colors: Ancients

Name: Critical Acclaim: The Acting Game
Description:
Critical Acclaim - The Acting Game is essentially a game of fun designed to allow you to lose your inhibitions while revealing those acting talents that have been lying dormant perhaps for years.

The aim of the game is to be the first to collect a predetermined number of points.  These are collected as players move around the board performing tasks that are rated for acting excellence by the other players.  The highest rating that can be given to the performance is worthy of "Critical Acclaim".

Name: Schneller Becher
Description:
From the Rulebook:
“Yummy ice cream!” “Strawberry, chocolate, vanilla….!” Ice cream man Mario whoops with delight. The children are fascinated as they watch him skillfully fling the scoops of ice cream into the sundae. How on earth does he do that? They beg him to repeat the feat. But Mario thinks of a better idea, “Come and try it yourself!” The little ice cream lovers don't
need a second invitation and in no time the scoops zip through the air!

Contents

    1 sundae (= tin)
    5 scoops of ice cream
    5 sundae cards
    49 ice cream cards
    Set of game instructions

Name: Stars Our Decimation, Ground Zero
Description:
THE STARS Our DECIMATION is the name for a series of interrelated science fiction wargames built around the actions mechanic. TSOD games all feature hand-built rules, hex grid regulated movement, a unique actions system, and versatile unit design rules.

Ground Zero is a tactical ground combat game, best suited to running company-level combats. Rules are based strongly on another game in the series - Voidstriker

Name: Sports Yesteryear
Description:
The object of Sports Yesteryear is to accumulate 100 points to your credit and have no cards left in your hand. 
Players roll dice and move around a board answering trivia questions in the following categories: Baseball, Football, Mixed bag and Terminology. Each card has a point value and each correct answer adds that amount to your over all score. Each incorrect answer deducts that amount from your overall score.

From the box: "The Number One Sports Trivia Game In America"

Name: Traverse
Description: Traverse is a word-finding puzzle game played on a 4x4 grid, similar to Boggle, but it uses 16 Scrabble-like tiles instead of d6 lettered dice.

Name: Who Took The Cookie from the Cookie Jar? Game
Description:
From the back of the tin:

"The ever popular children's rhyme "Who took the cookie from the cookie jar" is now a game that even pre-readers can enjoy.  Players travel around the cookie board and must either "give a cookie", "take a cookie", or say "not me"! Players actually choose their cookies from the special cookie jar shaped package.  First player to collect 3 unique cookie playing pieces wins!"

- No Reading Required
- Promotes Interaction
- Easy to Learn and Play

Name: What Do You Know About The Government
Description:
This is a 'Facts worth knowing' Game

What Do You Know About The Government from Milton Bradley copyrighted in 1939.

Game comes with 100 Questions and answers about the U. S. Government.

Name: Home Court Basketball
Description: Card driven Basketball game from 1955. The cover has a picture of Charlie Eckman a National Basketball referee who became the head coach of the Zollner Pistons.  Charlie was featured in the Saturday Evening Post, Time, and Sports Ilustrated.

Name: Ruby Rush!
Description:
In Ruby Rush, the players represent prospectors trying to cash in on a sudden up-cropping of rubies in the nearby landscape, while deterring the opposition.

The deck is 26 cards, and every card has a ruby value.  Most of the cards are action cards that allow players to "Dig" up more cards, steal from other players, etc.  Being too greedy can result in a cave-in, eliminating the player from the game.  When the deck is exhausted, the remaining players total their rubies, and the highest value wins; or if all but one player is eliminated, that player wins immediately.

The skill sets involved are risk management, and to a lesser degree, card-counting and bluffing.

Game rules include a variant for 4-5 players with the addition of another set of cards with the same game play.

Name: de Berend Boudewijn kwis
Description:
"De Berend Boudewijn Kwis" was a very popular quiz-show on the Dutch television during the early seventies. 
This game contains 100 cards with questions and three possible  answers (A-B-C). If you got it right, you earn plus-points (1 for A, 2 for B, 3 for C). If you got it wrong, the points are subtracted of your total. 
You can play against time, or to obtain a certain amount of points. 
Questions like: 
- When did the Titanic sink?
- In which country was gunpowder invented?
- What year was Kennedy shot?
- How fast can a pigeon fly?

Name: Shieldwall
Description:
Expands Warhammer Ancient Battles

Shieldwall - Warfare in the Viking Age, 790 to 1085 AD, is a 96-page sourcebook for Warhammer Ancient Battles. It contains a historical background and chronology outlining the important events as well as 28 detailed regional army lists for the Viking Age including:

Armies of the Norsemen
Including the Viking armies of the Danish, Norwegians and Hiberno Norse.

Armies of the English
Including the Saxon armies of Wessex, Mercia, and Anglia.

Armies of the Caledonians
Including the Scots and the Picts.

Armies of the Welsh
Including Gwynedd and Powys.

Armies of the Irish
Including Munster, Leinster and Ulster.

Armies of the Western Franks
Including the armies of the Carolingian French and Duchy of Normandy.

Hire mercenaries from the Dogs of War list to compliment your army
Including the Gall Gaedhil - the Sons of Death and mercenary Sergeants from Italy or Northern Spain.

Shieldwall also contains a set of new scenarios and a narrative campaign system to re-fight the warfare typical of the Viking Age, as well as detailed notes on wargaming tactics, and collecting and painting the armies of the Viking Age.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Auf hoher See
Description:
The game is played on 7×7 grid game board. The 4 corner spaces are the home harbours, where the players start with their ship. The 45 other spaces form the sea, which is filled with 45 wave chips. A red(!) pirate ship is placed in the middle of the board.

The harbours contain 3 of 4 merchandise with prices that are defined by a dice throw at the beginning of the game. A player can load his ship with up to 2 merchandise and must deliver them in another harbour than they are bought from.

Each turn, a player must make 3 moves: 1 wave, his ship and the pirate ship. Waves are stacked upon each other, ships cannot jump over other ships. Movement is determined by the number of waves and playing pieces on the starting space, but a wave must be left back at every crossed space during a move. In this way, the waves shift constantly over the sea giving a really floating sea feeling.

Winner is the player who has earned a previously fixed amount of gold pieces the first.

Name: Pension Munter
Description:
The game "Pension Mutter" was included in Spielbox 1/90 as part of the "Spiel im Heft/Game in the zine" series.

The board depicts a hotel lobby showing the reception desk and the key cabinet. The game can be played with a 32-card Skat deck or with 32 self made cards: 11 hotel key cards, 11 guests, 8 move cards, 1 concierge and 1 guest book card.

Object of the game is to find the correct (hidden) keys for the 11 guests that will enter the lobby during the game. The concierge (Jack of Hearts) acts as steering element for the keys. The guests will appear randomly from the 19 card deck containing the move and guest cards.

Winner is the player who has collected the highest number or guest/key pairs.

Name: Wellen-Halma
Description:
The game "Wellen-Halma" was included in Spielbox 4/90 as part of the "Spiel im Heft/Game in the zine" series. It is played on a 8x8 grid board with 5 specially marked 2x2 squares.

Each player has 12 playing pieces which are placed on the board at fix positions. 4 neutral pieces complete the starting position with all 28 pieces on the board.

Object of the game is to either occupy one of the five 2x2 squares with his own pieces or form one of 2 special pentagons anywhere on the board. The neutral pieces can be counted as own pieces by both players.

Each turn, a player can move a playing piece either 1-2 straight spaces in one of the 8 directions or by making a chess-knights move.

The name "Wellen-Halma" (="Wave checkers") comes from what follows after a playing piece has moved: all adjacent playing pieces are moved away for 1 space, if the are not protected by pieces behind them!

Name: Here I Stand: 2-Player Diplomacy Deck
Description:
The Here I Stand: 2-Player Diplomacy Deck allows two players to go head-to-head as the Papacy and the Protestants, with the four other major powers continuing to influence the game.  19 new cards in this expansion.
The rule adjustments for this variant run about 3 pages. Playing time for experienced players is under 3 hours.

Issue Nr19 of RBM's C3i Magazine includes the variant. It is the first set of playing cards ever published with the Magazine (other than Rise of the Luftwaffe cards that needed to be cut apart for use).

This variant is also included in the deluxe edition of Here I Stand.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Der Pate
Description:
The game "Der Pate" was included in Spielbox 6/90 as part of the "Spiel im Heft/Game in the zine" series.

The board is played on a large hexagon containing 184 hexes. 6 home cities in the middle circle are surrounded by 2 x 6 free cities in the outer and inner part of the board.

30 playing pieces and 1 special piece (the "pate") per player are provided, but at the beginning of the game, each player just starts with 2 pieces and his pate in one of the 6 home cities.

Depending on the number of players, 26-72 playing cards are needed for play (one suit=13 cards per player). These cards enable to buy new playing pieces, make movements or assassination attempts and help to protect your pate.

The pate is a figure that you must protect from being lost, because otherwise, you have to start from the beginning, with just the 2+1 playing pieces. The best protection would be to marry him and to get a son, who can replace your pate if needed!

As soon as the first player occupies 7 of the 12 free cities, the game is over and he is declared the winner.

Name: Farbstrakt
Description:
The game "Farbstrakt" was included in Spielbox 1/91 as part of the "Spiel im Heft/Game in the zine" series.

The board consists of 2 halves of 5x10 grids, which must be layed together so that at least 2 spaces connect the two halves.

The 100 spaces on the board are coloured in one of 5 different colours and show numbers from 0-9. 5 playing pieces in these 5 colours is the only material that is needed for this game.

The game consists of a race between these 5 pieces. The players secretly write down a ranking list before the game begins.

Each player can move any playing piece, and the distance a piece can move is determined by the numbers on the board, where all 5 pieces are standing.

Winner of the game is not the player who reaches the finish line with a playing piece first, but the one who has predicted the ranking of the race the best.

Name: Football Fantasy
Description: A series of books, each representing a different football (soccer, not American football) team. The mechanics are similar to the Lost Worlds series of books: each page shows a view of that team, so a player holds the book of his or her opponent's team (and the picture shows a view of the opposing team as he or she sees it). On each turn, each player chooses one of six available maneuvers and calls out the corresponding letter. A 6x6 grid at the bottom of each page indicates the result (new page) for each player.
Families: Series: Picture Book Games (Nova Game Designs)

Name: Cookie Jar
Description:
From the publisher's web site:

Cookie Jar is an accusations and alibis dice game. Everyone is a suspect, but only one person is the guilt party. Cookie Jar is a mixture of strategy and roleplaying. Each player needs bring fifteen 6-sided dice to the game (and to avoid confusion they should all be the same color, but different from the other players). Suitable for all ages, each session of Cookie Jar last no longer than 30-minutes.

Name: Flying Colors: Ship of the Line
Description:
Ship of the Line is the first expansion to Flying Colors. It primarily (although not exclusively) covers major fleet actions during the period of the American Revolution. The expansion includes sixteen total scenarios and adds over 100 new, individually named and rated ships as well as over 30 new commanders. Scenarios include:

1. Quiberon Bay, 20 November 1759
2. 1st Ushant, 27 July 1778
3. Rhode Island, 11 August 1778 (hypothetical)
4. Saint Lucia, 15 December 1778
5. Grenada, 6 July 1779
6. The Moonlight Battle, 16 January 1780
7. Porto Praya Bay, 16 April 1781
8. Fort Royal, 29 April 1781
9. Doggersbank, 5 August 1781
10. Sadras, 17 February 1782
11. The Saintes I, 9 April 1782
12. The Saintes II, 12 April 1782
13. Providien, 12 April 1782
14. Negapatam, 6 July 1782
15. Trincomalee, 3 September 1782
16. Cuddalore, 20 June 1783

In addition to these sixteen scenarios, Age of Sail aficionados can recreate the struggle between Admirals Suffren and Hughes with newly introduced campaign rules. Players must maintain their vessels through five historical confrontations, and may or may not receive reinforcements to continue their fight for control of the Indian Ocean.

Also included in Ship of the Line are a new "Map D" (which mates with maps from Flying Colors), two updated player aid cards, the most recent set of rules incorporating changes and corrections, and plenty of additional status markers.

This expansion is included in Flying Colors (GMT deluxe third edition).

Name: Giro d'Italia
Description:
Giro d'Italia is a bike racing game for 3 to 4 players.

The board depicts a race track that is 40 hexes long and 3-4 hexes wide. Each player has 4 playing pieces, 4 speed cards (numbered 3, 5, 6, and 8), and 3 chips.

The game is played over one round. It simulates a real bike race which includes effects like slipstreaming and blocking. Movement is handled with the 4 speed cards, where all 4 cards must be assigned to one of the 4 playing pieces. The speed can be increased by slipstreaming or by sacrificing chips. In the middle and end of the race, chips are won by the first three arrivals. The winner of the game is the player with the most chips at the end.

Originally published in spielbox 1991 #3 as part of the "Spiel im Heft/Game in the zine" series.

Name: Jomack
Description:
"The most versatile game of the century

It's an exciting and fast paced word game where everyone has an equal chance to play every turn. It's a game you can play with your grandparents or your grandchildren and everyone in between. Best of all, it's a family fun game where the only limit is your imagination."

In the base game, three random letter cards are revealed, and first player to call out a word containing all three of the letters gets to add it to their score sheet. First player to 11 words wins.

There are five other variant rule sets included, such as "Point Jomack", where longer words are better - you get additional points for each added letter.

Name: Count on Buzz Lightyear Card Game
Description:
Count on Buzz Lightyear is a card game in which players must get rid of cards in their hands by creating math equations.  Each time an equation can be made, using one card from the hand and two cards from the table, the player gets to put down  the card from the hand that was used.  When one player has rid himself of all cards in his hand, the other players add up the points left in their hands and another round is dealt.  Play continues until all players but one have passed 50 points.

The theme of the game is Toy Story, and each number card, 1-10, features a picture (drawing) of one of the Toy Story characters.  Buzz Lightyear cards are wild cards and can represent any number (but, if left in your hand, count for 11 points each).  This game would be best for children in early grade school, as they develop their basic math skills.  The suggested age of 7+ is pretty accurate, although enjoyment of the game will depend greatly upon the player's math skills.

Name: Gå på marknad
Description: Swedish children's game where you have to collect different animals at the market and then transport them home to your farm. The animal to be picked up is decided by pressing a "barn" that will then sound as one of the animals (horse, cow, pig or dog). The first to get one of each animal home to their farm wins.

Name: "Seven by one Stroke"
Description:
The brave little Taylor from  the fairy Tales, has made a jam Bread for his hungry stomach. Going only a short while away dozens of Flies attacking his Bread and want to eat the entire Bread... Who is faster? Did the Flies can eat the entire Bread before the Brave little Taylor is Return and hits "Seven by on Stroke" or not...

2 to 4 Players from 4 Years up are recommended to play this small Game. Rolling one Dice and setting one Fly to one of the 9 Parts of the Bread which has the same number of Points on it (Side of one dice similar to the rolled Dice). If enough flies, from your Color sitting on one Part, you earn the Piece and take it beside of you. Than take a card and hopefully it isn't the third flycatcher. If this is happens the Games End and the Taylor takes the Flycatcher and hits maybe "Seven by one Stroke". The player with the highest number of Pieces (for older Children add the number of Points) is the winner. Alternatively the players must reach a number of Points/Pieces to win or the Taylor has won the Game....

The Rules can be downloaded for personal Purposes and for Free via the Internet and this site.

German Description:
"Sieben auf einen Streich" ist der deutsche Titel des schon 1998 publizierten Spieles der Firma: General Games Company. 
Der englische Titel lautet "Seven by one Stroke".
Dieses Spiel hat nichts mit dem Spiel der Firma Clementoni zu tun!

Bei Sieben auf einen Streich, müssen die Spieler (ab 5 Jahre) Ihre Fliegen, soviel von den neun Teilen eines Marmeladenbrotes aufessen wie möglich, bevor das tapfere Schneiderlein zurückkommt und "Sieben auf einen Streich" erwischt. Jeder spieler hat seine Fliegen und setzt je nach geworfenen Würfeln seine Fliegen auf die Teile des Brotes. Sind genügend eigene Fliegen auf einem Brotteil, dann nimmt der Spieler der Die nötige Anzahl erreicht hat das Teil an sich. Er zieht eine Karte vom Stapel. Ist es ein Haufen Fliegen mit Krümeln dann geht das Spiel weiter. Erwischt der Spieler ein Karte mit einer Fliegenklatsche kommt das Spielende ein Stück näher. Bei der dritten gezogenen Fliegenklatsche, nimmt der Spieler welche diese gezogen hat, die beiligende Fliegenklatsche und haut einmal kräftig auf die übriggebliebenen Spielteile. Dann ist das Spiel zu Ende. Wer die meisten Punkte hat is der Sieger.
 Die Regeln können für den privaten Gebrauch frei aus dem Internet heruntergeladen werden und natürlich auch von dieser Site.

Name: The Coping Skills Game
Description: Another Child'sPlay game designed for therapy/teaching coping skills. Children roll a die and move around a track. When landing on different spaces, children are posited situations to which they must respond or a coping skills card. When a player responds to a card in a suitably acceptable way, he or she receives a victory point chip. Theoretically, at the end of the game, the player with the most chips wins. However, the game is focused more around helping children to develop nine positive coping skills than a winner.

Name: The Talking, Feeling, And Doing Game
Description:
From the Rules
This game was devised to enable the therapist to learn about the underlying psychological processes of such children, in a way that is non-threatening. It utilizes the vehicle of the standard game--so universally appealing to children--and the elicitation of responses via token reinforcement. The game has proved helpful in shortening the therapeutic process--not only because it provides the therapist with information earlier than he would have otherwise obtained it, but also because it facilitates the child's freeing himself enough to reveal his previously suppressed and repressed thoughts, feelings, and actions. The game can be useful in both individual and group psychotherapy with children. And even the child who will engage in direct discussion, psychoanalytic inquiry, and fantasy play can find it a pleasurable additional psychotherapeutic experience. It is most useful in treatment of children between the ages of four (children younger than that cannot usually  play board games) and twelve (the adolescent will often consider the game "babyish").

IMPORTANT NOTICE
Talking, Feeling, and Doing Game was designed to be used only by mental health professionals in their therapeutic work with children. Accordingly , every reasonable attempt is made to limit the sale and distribution of the game to such professionals. Use of the game by parents with their own children is therapeutically contraindicated. Most parents are not trained to provide appropriate therapeutic responses to the cards. And even those who are, are not likely to have the objectivity with their own children that is necessary for optimum utilization of the game. Lastly, such play with parents will compromise the child's use of the game with his or her therapist.

Name: Kingsbridge Solitaire Game
Description: Kingsbridge Solitaire Game comes with a board, a styrofoam card holder, two decks of small cards and a book: "150 ways to play Solitaire." The game box says that the game is for children, convalescence, vacationists, invalids, home players, and travelers.

Name: Ghost
Description:
Ghost is a classic word game wherein one player provides a starting letter, the other adds a letter, and so on until either player completes a word, or one player challenges the other, claiming that the sequence so far is part of no legal words.  A variant, Superghost, allows for letters to be added to either the start or end of the existing sequence.

The game is described in its Wikipedia article, and James Thurber wrote about Superghost for The New Yorker with his essay "Do You Want to Make Something Out of It? (Or, if you put an "o" on "understo," you'll ruin my "thunderstorm")"

Name: World at War: Update 2005 Pack
Description:
The World at War has been widely recognized as the best unauthorized expansion for Axis and Allies TM for over 15 years.

     The World at War starts in 1938.
     Special events like the Fall of France and the Japanese sneak attack on Pearl Harbor are re-enacted and can produce different outcomes.
     Rules and special troops are included for units such as the German SS, Panzers, Tiger Tanks, Rockets, U.S. Marines, Kamikazis, Banzai attacks and others
     Technologies are expanded.
     Rules include special events such as the Fall of France and the assassination attempt on Hitler.
     The battle for the Atlantic takes on new dimensions with German submarines doing economic damage to Britain
     Strategic bombing is expanded to be truly strategic.
     etc.

Name: Back of Beyond: Army Lists and Campaign System for Contemptible Little Armies – Central Asia 1919-1926
Description:
This is a supplement to Contemptible Little Armies: Third Edition â€“ World War I Era: Fast Play Wargame Rules 1910-1928. It includes some historical background, army lists, a simple campaign system, special characters and new optional rules for terrain and weather specific to warfare in Central Asia from 1919- 1926.

The armies in the lists represent historical forces as well as a few “what ifs”. They include: Bolsheviks, the “Army of God”, White Russians, the Army of Baron Ungern-Sternberg, Chinese Warlord Armies, Chinese Chinghai Fontier Armies, Chinese Bandits, Mongolian Tribes, Tibetans, Ngoloks, Basmachis, the Afghan Army, Central Asian Bandits, the Army of British India, the Turkish Army, the Japanese Army, and Dinosaur Hunters.

The book has 41 single sided pages that are cerlox bound with a plastic cover on the front. There are a couple of black and white photos within and one map.

Expands:

    Contemptible Little Armies: Third Edition â€“ World War I Era: Fast Play Wargame Rules 1910-1928

Name: The Helping, Sharing, and Caring Game
Description:
From the rules

The therapeutic game has enjoyed widespread utilization throughout North America and abroad. The Helping, Sharing, and Caring Game is a derivative of the therapeutic instrument-- specifically designed for children, their siblings, their parents, and other adults with whom children may be involved. The cards that Dr. Gardner considered most directly relevant to the therapeutic situation have been replaced with cards that are of educational value, especially with regard to ethics and values that are important to impart to children. The cards also facilitate interpersonal communication.

Name: Stop Relax & Think
Description:
Players roll and move along a track. Players must satisfy the conditions of either stopping, relaxing (engaging in an activity that is thought of as relaxing), or thinking. When a player has successfully traversed the track, he or she wins.

From the creator:

STOP, RELAX, and THINK evolved out of my work with children at Fourth Street Project over the last four years. We work with a lot of impulsive children at Fourth Street on gaining greater skills in self-control. We have found that enhancing children's awareness of their feelings, teaching problem-solving skills and pairing that with relaxation training increases their ability to own their part in problems and to gain a greater internal locus of control.

Name: The Anger Solution Game
Description:
The Anger Solution Game helps children learn to control their behavior responses to anger. As players make their way around the board, they are faced with a series of decisions and learn to choose the success route over the victim cycle. The anger solution game is a unique therapeutic tool. The game includes a game board, 100 tokens, 1 solution spinner, 1 6-sided die, 24 empowerment cards, 58 question cards, and 40 solution cards.

From the Rules:
This game is intended to be played with adult supervision. Any empathetic adult (parent, teacher, counselor, etc.) can assist children to effectively identify, express, and manage their anger. Although anger is a natural emotion in response to conflict situations, it can jeopardize relationships if it is not communicated effectively and appropriately.

Typically, people react inappropriately to anger in one of two ways. The first is by overreacting to conflict situations by becoming verbally and/or physically explosive to others after allowing anger to build up. Secondly, a person may react to anger by internalizing their frustration with a conflict situation which often results in physiological or emotional symptoms of stress.

The Anger Solution Game  was developed through the integration of a psycho-educational approach with cognitive behavioral intervention modality. The main goal is to help the client to understand that he/she has control over behavioral responses to anger and that he/she can make choices which can result in positive solutions.

Name: The Dinosaur's Journey to High Self-Esteem
Description:
From the Rules 
Self-esteem is something everyone wants for their children. We assume that when children value themselves they will not only be happier, but will develop a strong sense of self. A strong identity will in turn be a resource for them to draw on as they meet the many challenges of growing up. Mental health professionals almost universally agree that lack of self-esteem can be a significant factor in a host of childhood disorder from depression to under-achievement to anti-social behavior.

The Dinosaur's Journey to High Self-Esteem reflects this multi-dimensional understanding of self-esteem. As children advance along the game board they draw cards which ask them to think about their values, friendships. ability to understand themselves and others, and their resources in meeting life's common problems. Each card presents a unique opportunity for a child to think and experience the building blocks of self-esteem.

Name: Octo
Description:
Octo is a member of the battleship family of paper and pencil games.  Each player sets up a board in secret, and then takes turns asking the other player about the board.

In Octo, the board is an 8x8 board.  Each player divides the board into eight sections of eight contiguous squares.  Play then alternates calling off rectangles for which the other player informs the number of each section within that rectangle.

Name: Warhammer: Fall of the West – A Supplement for Ancient Battles
Description:
This 80-page sourcebook contains information, rules and army lists covering the period that marked the end of the Western Roman Empire and the start of the Dark Ages - 350 AD to 468 AD.

The history of the end of the Western Roman Empire

Descriptions of the strategy, tactics, and composition of the late Romance army and its Barbarian opponents.

Biographies of famous Roman and Barbarian warlords, and rules for using them in Warhammer Ancient Battles.

Descriptions of the most famous battles of the period, and guidelines for re-fighting the battles with Warhammer Ancient Battles.

New scenarios and a campaign game for use with Warhammer Ancient Battles based on the border raids and small battles that were typical of warfare in this period.

Watch On The Rhine -- a complete skirmish game.

An army list that allows you to build the following armies: Roman Limitanei, Roman Comitatenses, Sea Raiders, Western Barbarians, Central Barbarians, Eastern Barbarians, North African, and Warlord.

Sections on tactics, painting, collecting an army, military organization and informative illustrations and color plates.

Expands:

    Warhammer Ancient Battles

Name: Kellogg's World's Champions Cereal League
Description: The Kellogg's World's Champions Cereal League was a game printed on the inside of a box of Kellogg's Corn Flakes. The box had to be taken apart and laid out flat in order to play. The panels on the box included the play area, a score card, and the game rules. This is considered by experts to be the first sports-related promotion in cereal-box history.

Name: Kölle Alaaf
Description:
This is a party game full of data about Cologne and its annual Mardi Gras celebration. Based on card instructions, players must answer questions about the festival, about the local dialect, draw or pantomime something, enumerate five examples of something, etc.

The title is a traditional expression in the Cologne area, first appearing in the writings of Prince Metternich in 1635.  It basically means "Cologne above all else", i.e. is the Cologners way of expressing their love of their city.

Technical details:
- Packing external dimensions: 27,5 * 20 * 5 cm,
- Weight: approx. 700 gram
- Board size: 46 * 31 cm (triple folded only 23 * 15.3 cm)
- Maps: 100 cards with 600 questions, 6 “Kölle Alaaf” cards and 4 “Klüngel” - maps
- 6 pawns (wood)
- Cubes: 1 color cube (wood)
- 1 Pappnase as minimum costume for all cases
- Age: from 11 to 111 years
- Play time: with 4 players approx. 111 min.

Name: Right Off The Bat
Description:
From the back of the box and the game rule book:

Right Off The Bat - a baseball game that required no skill because all plays would be determined by the roll of the dice.  An accurate and exciting game that could be played anytime, anywhere, with any teams of your choice, past or present - that produced its own realistic statistics.

You begin the game with the visiting team up first.  Each shake of the dice represents a pitch.  Proceed around the game board until there are three outs.  Leave your game piece on the 3rd out of each inning as you will begin from whatever space your third out is for the rest of the game.  Keep track of each man's at bats, balls, strikes, outs, hits, etc., and enter the total hits, runs, and errors, (if any), of each inning in the designated innings on the score card.  The Home Team does the exact same thing in the bottom of each inning.  Be sure to remove all base runners left on base at the end of each teams ups.  As in real baseball, the game is played for nine innings to determine a winner of the game.  If the Home team is ahead after 8 1/2 innings of play, the Home team wins and does not bat in the bottom of the 9th.

In the game rule book, there are 3 versions of game play that can be played from this gameboard.
Basic version is approximate 30 minutes playing time.
Intermediate version is approximate 30-60 minutes of playing time.
Advanced version is approximate 60-90 minutes of playing time.
There are also optional variations of play with each version.

Name: Blood Bath at Orc's Drift
Description:
Blood Bath at Orc's Drift is a campaign pack for use with 2nd edition Warhammer Fantasy. It contains the following components:

Orc's Drift Scenario Book
Command Sheets
Card Buildings
Cardboard Armies
Poster Map
Badge

The game is similar to other Warhammer campaign packs like Perilous Quest or Idol of Gork and provides a number of linked scenarios where the outcome in one scenario affects the starting positions in the next.

Name: Capt. Midnight's Mexican Ringo Jumpo Game
Description: Capt. Midnight's Mexican Ringo Jumpo Game comes on an 8.5X11” board for a game that utilized jumping beans. At corners are photos of Capt. Midnight, Steve & Patsy Donovan and Chuck Ramsey. Game circle is centered by logo for sponsor Skelly Oil. This game was offered in 1940 as a premium when you purchased oil.

Name: Lindbergh Gravity Game
Description: LINDBERGH GRAVITY GAME is a wood game made by the Hustler Toy Corporation of Sterling, Illinois. Gameboard shows New York in upper left, Paris in lower right. The object of the game is to get your glass balls from New York to Paris.

Name: The Mummy Mystery Game
Description: THE MUMMY MYSTERY GAME by Hasbro © 1963 from the Universal Pictures movie of the same name. Lid features stalking Mummy art  with text that says "Explore The Ancient Crypts Of Egypt."  The game board shows a Mummy walking through Egyptian ruins. Game includes 20 "Crypt" cards, 4 Mummy playing pieces  and 4 wooden markers.

Name: BOL (Balls Of Light)
Description:
BOL (Balls Of Light)
English Rules are available from the game page.

It is a funny race among "Balls Of Light" that may take the form they prefer and gain mad extra powers if they pick up the Energy Ball you can place in the Circuit. Very simple and interactive. Declare a number, roll two dice. If your score is equal to or greater than your declared number, you win your bet.  You then double your declared number and you can move your BOL on the circuit a number of hexes up to that number. If your score is lower, you lose your bet. You can move up to the score you obtained.

Apply all variants available in the rulesheet and on website at your will!

BOL have plenty of imagination: invent and propose new variants to other player: if a majority of other players like them, play them! Bump other Balls, gain extra charges, move right behind the leader with the teleport... and have fun!

Name: Frankenstein Mystery Game
Description: Frankenstein Mystery Game comes in a  deep box ( 9.5x19x1.5")  It was produced by Hasbro games in 1963 and is based on Universal Pictures movie of the same name. Box design includes large portrait and hand images of Frankenstein's monster, text reading "Find The Lurking Monster."  The board depicts a town w/larger inset images of city morgue, cemetery, woods, haunted house, tower and lab.    The game comes with a  w/built-in spinner showing three witches around cauldron , 4 Frankenstein figure player pieces with wooden bases.

Name: Dracula Mystery Game
Description: Dracula Mystery Game produced by Hasbro © 1963 from the  Universal Pictures movie of the same name. Lid reads "Will The Vampire Catch You?". This is a simple roll and move game.

Name: The Phantom of the Opera Mystery Game
Description: The Phantom of the Opera Mystery Game was produced by Hasbro in © 1963 and is based on the Universal Pictures movie from the same year. Box design includes large ghostly portrait of Phantom and a small image of him on an opera stage w/large shadow behind him.  Box text reads "Can You Escape From The Phantom's Dungeon?" . The game comes with 30 cards and a built-in spinner, four full color Phantom playing pieces and four wooden markers.
Families: Books: The Phantom of the Opera

Name: Snow White and the 7 Dwarfs Game
Description:
Snow White and the 7 Dwarfs Game

This game was issued by Tek Toothbrush/Johnson & Johnson and produced by Einson-Freeman Co. © 1937. The cardboard sheet w/game board and playing pieces opens to 14.5x21.5".  The board features choice illustrations including character portraits and inset story scenes. Has attached panel w/punch-out playing pieces and instructions. This is a simple move along the track game that has both good and bad places that one might land on.
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Snow White

Name: Edgehill: Dawning of the Revolution
Description:
This is an easy, introductory game on the first battle of the English Civil War, based on a system derived from the old SPI Thirty Years War system, modified with the introduction of a chit drawing leader activation procedure that makes the game different each time you play it and perfect for solitaire play. Easy to understand and fast playable (less than an hour), and full-color map (with the position of the different units printed on the map for an immediate set-up).

DTP Game.
Zip file contains:

     11 x 17" full color map (2 - 8.5 x 11" parts)
     113 full color counters.
     Rules in English and Italian


This FREE Print-n-Play game is available at WargameDownloads.com
http://www.wargamedownloads.com/item.php?item=552

Name: Yankee Doodle Baseball
Description:
Yankee Doodle Baseball from  the Russell Manufacturing Co. dated 1928.

Game listing comes from a compilation of games created by

Yahoo Group - Baseball Games Group;antique baseball games to modern tabletop sims

A description of the game will be created from information received from members of the group.

Name: Willie Mays "Say Hey" Baseball Game
Description:
Originally published as Say Hey! Its Willie Mays' Own Baseball Game, An Oliver Game (c) 1954 by Toy Development Co., Inc.

Later published as Willie Mays "Say Hey" Baseball Game by Centennial Game Co. in 1958.

Game comes with three spinners, one for the pitcher, one for the batter and one for the fielder. If the pitchers spinner indicates a strike or a ball then the batter can either take the pitch or swing at it. If he decides to swing he uses his spinner to determine if he in fact hits the ball and where it was hit to or if the batter misses it. Then the fielder has the opportunity to catch or field the ball. If the ball is in play a batters dial decides if the hit is a single, double, triple or home run.

There are rules for trying to bunt or steal. Things like wild pitches and passed balls are posible.

Name: Krieger's Baseball Game
Description:
Krieger's Baseball Game by the Krieger Novelty Co.

Game listing comes from a compilation of games created by: Yahoo Group ---- Baseball Games

Group;antique baseball games to modern tabletop sims at the following site

http://members.aol.com/Butch7999/BbTitles.htm

A description of the game will be created from information received by members of the group.

Name: The Knot Hole League Game
Description:
The Knot Hole League Game by  Goudey Gum Co.

Game listing comes from a compilation of games created by: Yahoo Group ---- Baseball Games Group;antique baseball games to modern tabletop sims at the following site http://members.aol.com/Butch7999/BbTitles.htm

A description of the game will be created from information received by members of the group.

Name: Batalha de Sao Borja
Description:
Batalha de São Borja is a postcard game available in issue 1 of Riachuelo Games' Strategos magazine.

The Battle of São Borja is one of the opening offensives of the Triple Alliance War (1864 - 1870), in which a small force of Brazilians defend São Borja (in the Brazilian state of Rio Grande dul Sul) against a much larger force of Paraguayans.

The Paraguayans must take São Borja in 11 turns or eliminate all the Brazilians. The Brazilians must prevent this from happening.

Counters: 8 Paraguayans vs. 6 Brazilian 
Stats:

Top Left: Range
Top Right: Defense
Bottom Left: Movement
Bottom Right: Attack

Name: Eine wird gewinnen
Description:
This game was published in the newspaper "taz" as an addition to the voting of "Kulturhauptstadt 2010" in Germany.

It is a simple yatzee-style dice-rolling game, where 16 different cities compete on being the "Kulturhauptstadt 2010".

Name: Zombie Nightmare
Description:
This is a nice little solitaire freebie from daVinci, in which you try to make it from the church steps to the cemetery gate. (Un)Naturally, up to 12 zombies and 2 zombie dogs try to stop you!  You move faster than they do (except for the dogs), and have one whole bullet available, but the undead keep popping up all over the board.  Worse, if you do finally reach the gate, you may find it blocked, and have to spend movement points clearing the way.

The game is available at: http://www.davincigames.it/giocarea_eng/18/dagiocare.htm

Warning: the rules are in "Engrish" and almost incomprehensible.  I will put my translation in the files section.
